newsitem.title: UK: U.S. stocks firm in London, Dow seen up 50-60 pts.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks firm in London, Dow seen up 50-60 pts.

text.p: Reassuring comments from Japan's Finance Ministry helped U.S. stocks rebound across the board in London on Tuesday, reversing part of Monday's steep and panicked sell-off, dealers said.

Most U.S. stocks were up $1/4 to $1/2 in London, while the September S&P 500 index futures contract bounced 7.35 points to 889.10 on Globex, pointing to a 50 to 60 point mark-up on the Dow at the open, dealers said.
The rebound followed comments from Japanese officials on Tuesday who played down Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto's warning about possible Japanese disposal of U.S. Treasuries.
